title: Robert Frost: a first acquaintance
creator_credit: Films for the Humanities and Harold Mantell
brief_description: Describes how the poems which first made American poet Robert Frost famous were based on his experiences as a farmer in New England. Shows Frost reading his poems to a student audience, and his daughter, Lesley Frost, discussing some of Frost’s poems and his poetic theories. Suitable for middle and upper seconday levels.
